definition: head of a flight of stairs
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: But that night she sat on the top of the stairs with her head on her crossed arms and cried.
sentences.chinese: 可是那個晚上，她坐在樓梯口上抱頭痛哭。

sentences.english: They followed him out of the nursery and along the corridor to the staircase.
sentences.chinese: 他門跟着他走出育兒室，穿過走廊來到樓梯口。

sentences.english: A milky twilight crept about the stairway and the landings below.
sentences.chinese: 乳白的黃昏躡進樓梯和下面的樓梯口。

sentences.english: Follow the smell, I came to the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 順着香味，我來到了樓梯口。

sentences.english: Accompanying with the sound, a young woman from stairs turn into the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 伴着這聲響，一個年青的女子從樓梯口拐入了走廊。

sentences.english: He was escorted by the aged secretary out of the glass door and all the way to the stairwell.
sentences.chinese: 他一直被這年邁的書記送出玻璃門，又送到樓梯口。

sentences.english: There was no one in the corridor. He hastened to the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 過道里已沒有人，他衝到樓梯口。

sentences.english: Mr. Tapley appeared to be taking his ease on the landing of the first floor.
sentences.chinese: 塔普利先生想必正逍遙自在地在二樓的樓梯口歇着呢。

sentences.english: She was standing at the top of the stairs, hanging on to the banister.
sentences.chinese: 她站在樓梯口上，緊緊地握住欄杆。

definition: erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
